title: James Blunt asks Kate Garraway for kidney to save sick father
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

James Blunt revealed his father is currently waiting for a kidney transplant and asked if presenters Ben Shephard and Kate Garraway might donate theirs during today’s Good Morning Britain.

The divisive singer is back with a new album, Once Upon A Mind, which he’s described as his most personal yet, chronicling a particularly painful chapter in Blunt’s life, trying to save his dad, Charles Blount, a former cavalry officer in the 13th/18th Royal Hussars, helicopter pilot and colonel in the Army Air Corps.

Opening up about the anguish, which became part of the inspiration behind his new record, Blunt smiled: ‘He needs a new kidney, he’s a kidney donor and I’ve come here to ask you if you’re O positive? I’ll take [a kidney] off you.’

The 45-year-old wanted to try and donate his own kidney, but discovered he wasn’t a match. Blunt admitted expressing his emotions comes much easier to him through music.

‘When you realise your father’s mortality it’s great to take the opportunity to say the things I’d like to say to him so there’s a song on [the album] called Monsters For Him,’ Blunt continued.

‘We’re two grown men, we don’t need to say goodbye, we don’t need to forgive, we don’t need to forget, I know your mistakes and you know mine.’

Though, the father-of-two assured it’s not ‘all misery’ on his sixth LP.

James Blunt opened up about his sick father on Good Morning Britain (Picture: ITV)

‘I’ve got songs for my children, who are hugely inspiring to me. I go away on tour a lot and leave my wife to pick up the pieces of that new family so there’s songs on there for her too,’ he enthused.

Blunt – who came under fire last week for suggesting Brexit won’t change lives – also defended pals Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, who opened up about their own mental health struggles during a candid ITV documentary last Sunday (October 20).

Good morning Britain airs weekdays from 6am on ITV while James Blunt’s new album Once Upon A Time will be available from Friday October 25.
